channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why the Met brought a 200-foot-long window back to life in its renovated wing

item.title: Lonely? You Don’t Need an AI Friend, You Need a Book
item.description: Mark Zuckerberg is pushing AI friends as a solution to loneliness, but a better technology already exists—books.

item.title: The largest Fortune 500 company has 2 million employees. These 8 have under 2,000
item.description: These small but mighty companies on the Fortune 500 raked in more than $87 billion in combined revenue over the past year.

item.title: This little-known AI darling is climbing the Fortune 500 faster than any other company
item.description: Super Micro Computer skyrocketed 206 spots on the Fortune 500, thanks to its pivotal role in powering the AI boom.

item.title: This interactive map shows you what your NYC block looked like 400 years ago

item.title: As boomers are forced to ‘unretire’ because they’ve not saved enough, 6-year-olds in Germany could soon have retirement accounts
item.description: Millions of baby boomers can't afford to retire. It’s a fate that Gen Alpha in Germany may never have to face under new plans.

item.title: Pinterest wooed Gen Zers. Will AI pins drive them away?

item.title: Why Doesn’t Mark Cuban Dress for Success? Because You Should ‘Beware the Person in the T-shirt’
item.description: ‘Shark Tank’ Shark Robert Herjavec on why the worst-dressed person in the room is often the most powerful.

item.title: AI-built startups could fuel increase in venture capital ‘zombie’ funds
item.description: The number of zombie VC funds has jumped by 50% since the end of 2021.

item.title: Women run 11% of Fortune 500 companies in 2025—but progress is still slow
item.description: Fifty-five Fortune 500 companies are led by women CEOs this year.

item.title: The Stock Market Isn’t Buying the Bears’ Gloomy Outlook
item.description: The S&P 500 just posted its best May since 1990.

item.title: Deanna Strable’s Journey from Intern to CEO of Principal Financial Group Is Inspiring—but May Become Increasingly Rare
item.description: Insider CEOs slightly outperform outsiders, but many boards value external experiences.

item.title: United Airlines Just Made Me Very Happy That I Put Off Making a Change in My Wallet. It Might Benefit You, Too
